Home Mush The Lounge Roleplay[SG][RP][SA] The Open Story: Deadlaus
On july 11, 2014
EoNightcore

Ok, You heard of the Open Story?
Well, Welcome back. (Versaito, I'm sorry, the original got too confusing)
Anyways, new rules is that we're bringing back Player Characters.

HOWEVER!
Player characters can talk to and take direct action against other players, but you will mostly stick to your own path. However, you can do things that will influence other characters, like destroying their home because it's funny, and then later the other player character's reason for joining the military was because someone destroyed their home for the giggles.

If players are not online for some time, we will turn your character into an NPC.

I'm also adding something called the party, it's where you can add NPCs to your group, and they will become your Player Characters.

Please, no Mary Sues, we don't want an immortal bring with the ability to kill everything just by extending their finger and be able to seduce anyone.

You can take control of NPCs, but you cannot control other people's PCs. If you do take control of a NPC, then please remember to actually move your PC as well.

Beyond that, we just need to begin the story, and we're good to go!
On july 11, 2014

Misterme7

Bob opened up his briefcase to look through the files inside. Going to be a tough case. The police found the leader of a major crime syndicate, and raided his home. Tons of evidence. Transaction notebooks, illegal goods... Everything to prove it was right there. Honestly, could the guy have left anymore evidence it was him? I usually don't bother to take lost causes. They're a waste of time. But when enough money comes into play, anybody can be convinced. "It's almost like he wanted to be found!" muses Bob as he reread his opening statement...(This a good story beginning, or at least contribution?)

On july 11, 2014
[8356287]

Steve was laughing maniacally as he slammed his fist down on the Big Red Button to open the rear cargo bay doors of his freighter plane. He throttled the engine and pulled up hard to stall the plane in a nearly vertical position. The frantic trumpeting of elephants quickly faded into the distance...

Jessica: MY BABIES!! What have you done?!?!

The plane swirled into a tail-spin and Steve struggled to regain control.

Voice on the headset: Have you deployed the package?

Steve: ......Yep..... HANG ON.....

The plane was now in a nose-dive, accelerating toward the skyscrapers below. Finally, Steve managed to pull it back from the brink, just a few hundred feet above the skyline.

Steve: WHOOOOO!!!!!!!!! God, what a RUSH!

Voice on the headset: Please report. What is the disposition?

Steve: Right on target, baby! HA! I'm just glad I'm not in the city park right now! ...Hm, actually, I take that back - I really wish I COULD see it. What a MESS!!

Jessica lunged against the ropes that restrained her in the co-pilot's seat. She glared at Steve with intense hatred, vowing to kill that horrible monster of a man..... This was her new purpose in life.

On july 11, 2014
Harrivchan

Meanwhile at the park

Dan: Gurgle, Gurgle, Hack, Sputter I-i'm awake sir ! Oh yeah, I was just napping here, Heh..... What's that ruckus ?! Goddamnit ! Why can't i just sleep without anything bothering me !!

Still half-awake, He shambled to the nearest water source and drank it, Before realizing that he drank from a dirty water fountain, Making him aware now

Dan: Pah ! Fuck me......

A loud boom was heard, Unaware of the loud sound, Dan flinched and slipped on a puddle of water

Dan: Agh ! Now my jeans is wet, Thanks a lot God ! I really need to check that sound, It could be serious

He ran toward the source of the sound, Only to find a hectic scene going on, sirine is heard from a distance, Eager to know, Dan approached one of the police officer

Dan: Sir, What's happening ?!

Police officer: Please, Step away sir, It's dangerous here !

Dan: Just tell me what's going on and i'll leave

Police officer: Step away, sir, It's for your own good !

Dan: You listen here ! I just want to kno--

Suddenly a loud boom is heard from the law firm, Although he was expecting a bomb, He didn't really believe that a bomb is in there

Police officer: Stay down !

Dan: O-ok.....

He was going to be a witness in this case, and so Bob hadn't had much contact since he seemed to be avoiding Bob. EoNightcore

The Shadow Boss stared quietly in his office.

Shadow Secretary: Sir, you should probably get some sunshine.

Shadow Boss: You know what, maybe you're right. Tell the Officer Workers they're getting a small pay raise, just because I'm feeling nice today.

The Shadow Boss came out of his room, and got into an elevator with a bunch of other random people.

This random group of people exited among several floors of the building, before the Shadow Boss, who was actually dressed like an Office Worker and was indistinguishable from them, exited to the outer world with them.

Little did he know, he was being tracked by a group of individuals, a very EVIL group of people.

On july 11, 2014
EoNightcore
Versatio Oh, wow, nobody took me up on the offer to retract the absurdity? Damn, now I've got to figure out who would hire a psychotic pilot to drop elephants in the park, and more importantly, WHY.... Hmmm, working on that....

You doubt the craziness of the internet Versatio? Do not doubt us! Everything in the Open Story is open for discussion. If a crazy CEO can sit in a dark room all day without no trouble, then I have no doubt that even more crazy stuff can happen!

Who knows, maybe the mole people will invade,
Or maybe a bunch of super-soldiers appear who only use paint-ball guns,
Or maybe it turns out we all live in a opposite world where elves and such actually do exists!
OR MAYBE WE'RE ALL ACTUALLY SMALL CHARACTERS IN A HUGE WAR BETWEEN THE FORCES OF GOOD AND EVIL, EXCEPT THEY DON'T ACTUALLY EXIST!!
OR MAYBE A MAD SCIENTIST HAS CREATED FOOD MONSTERS AND BOTTLE WATER MONSTERS AND PACKAGE MONSTERS THAT CREATE MORE FOOD MONSTERS, AND HE PLANS TO COVER THE WORLD IN A FOOD JUNGLE THAT WILL SOLVE STARVATION, BUT KILL MOST OF HUMANITY OFF!!!

Officer Worker David: Hey Joe, you hear about the boss's new Secretary?

Officer Worker Joe: No, what about his new Secretary?

Officer Worker David: They say she's an actual Elf!

OW Joe: Really? I thought Elves didn't come this far in-land.

OW David: I don't know what the boss did, but we better stay quiet, or the manager will hear us.

OW Harold: Hey? What are you guys talking about?

OW David: They say the boss's new Secretary is an actual Elf!

OW Harold: An Elf? Damn, what I would give to get a taste of that.

OW Jow: Shhhhhhhhhhh, if they hear you you could get fired, or worse.

[8356287]

Assistant: President Maubrick?

Maubrick: Yes?

Assistant: Operation Du- d- DUMBO Drop has proceeded as planned. The "package" is right on target, and there's very little wind, so the parachutes shouldn't be blown off cour-

Maubrick: PARACHUTES?! I didn't say anything about parachutes!

Assistant: Oh, um, I just assumed, because, uhh... wouldn't that be... inhumane?

Maubrick: That's the POINT, you imbecile! The bombs drive the office workers out to the park, then they witness the gory spectacle, and they'll be so traumatized that business will grind to a halt. They'll stay home alone for a few days, where our agents can pay them a visit to share some wonderful SPORES with them. Once they get back to work, we'll have gained complete control of the five largest corporations in the entire Sol system. This is a major strategic operation, don't tell me you've screwed it up!

Assistant: ....Well... I, um... There are reports that the elephants are attacking humans now.

Maubrick: Hmm..... This could still work to our advantage. Leave me! I have some planning to do....
On july 11, 2014
EoNightcore

Shadow Boss could feel someone looking at him, luckily he had created several back-up areas to disguise himself from the paparazzi. The Shadow Boss quickly went into a clothing store, and bought some clothes.
He came out looking like a different person, no one would notice who he was as well.
That's when an elephant came and threw him.
He got knocked out.

============

Next thing he knew, he was in the hospital, and he was sitting in a dark room.

Shadow Boss: What the hell happened?

Sitting next to him, was his Secretary, a forest elf he had "rescued" from a bunch of raiders back in the more savage parts of Europa (not Europe, Europa, with an a).

Shadow Secretary: Sir, I suggest you don't get up, it's rather bad for your health.

Shadow Boss: Why do you call me Sir?

Shadow Secretary: Because you saved my life.

Shadow Boss: Yes, but that does not mean you need to call me sir.

Shadow Secretary: Then, your highness?

Shadow Boss: No....

Shadow Secretary: My lord?

Shadow Boss: That's even more embarrassing. Just call me by my first name.

Shadow Secretary: Then... John.

SB John: Yes, that'll be nice. Now tell me, how did I end up here?

Shadow Secretary: Someone called 911, and you were driven to one of our hospitals.

SB John: I see... Say, what is your name anyways?

Shadow Secretary: Oh you do not need to know my name my lord!

John twitched, he wasn't going to get used to this.

SB John: No, please, tell me.

Shadow Secretary: Please my lord, I am not dignified enough to tell you my name!

SB John: I assure you are.

Shadow Secretary: It's... It's... My name is-

============

Yeah, like I would reveal her name right here and now. Ha!
At least we know who the Shadow Boss is, right? He's the CEO of Crossbow Technologies! John "Crossbow" Fletcher the Third! His father was John "Longbow" Fletcher the Second.

On july 11, 2014
EoNightcore

ALright guys, some stuff because i feel like it.
We have no idea what century this is.
Guns do exist, yes.
The Fletcher Family is a noble family from the British Isles, located on the continent of Europa, the family likes to make their kids learn the ancient tradition of bow shooting.
Elves do exist, yes.
We can assume magic does exist.
Elves like to use Sniper Rifles, so I suggest you don't piss them off, as they are very, very smart when it comes to calculating where to shoot so it hits you in the head.

On july 11, 2014
EoNightcore

John was wheelchaired into Dark Meeting Room by his Secretary, and then the screens flickered

???1: Hello John. We, the council, are interested in what you have to bring us today.

John: Gentlemen, I do believe a group of people are planning to remove me as CEO.

???2: What? Outrageous!

???3: Surely you must be jesting.

???4: He is a member of the Bow Fletcher Family! He must be right!

???1: Where is your proof? John Fletcher?

John: Who in their sane minds would drop elephants in the middle of the city? Only an evil organization would dare do that. Coupled with the fact that in this peaceful city, with crime rates lower then any other, there has been a bombing at the Law Firm, and a drive-by with assault rifles at the the Police Station, gives me proof that someone, out there, is planning to remove me as CEO.

???2: You're lying! You just want more po-

???1: Let him continue!!

John: As such, if I am removed, then you, the council, loses a valuable piece, because I provide you resources that cannot be created by just any person.

???1: Interesting, what other proof do you have of this... mysterious group that plans to replace you?

John: My men have been tracking a group, a very secret group of people, they are not from here, and they do not play nice. They convert people by infecting others against their will, they seek to create all life in their image. Even more, they act as our ancestor's enemies did, converting the government by secret, before causing a big war in which most of life will be wiped out, and then attempting to convert the rest. As the council, it was, IT IS our duty to ensure this does not happen again.

???1: Very... well. We shall send you funds and men, but do not be fooled John Fletcher, one step out of line, and we will replace you.

John: I only live to serve the council.

The Screens flickered off.
John gestured to his Secretary.

John: Can you push me to Arms Development?

Shadow Secretary: Very well John.

John was pushed out of the Meeting Room.

On july 11, 2014
[8202554]

I think there has to be mushes because Infecting them aganist their will looks like mush stuff to me
On july 11, 2014
EoNightcore
ManuelI think there has to be mushes because Infecting them aganist their will looks like mush stuff to me

There are lots of Alien species that infect others against their will.
Wasps infect Caterpillars by laying their young inside the Caterpillar, thus the Caterpillar becomes a host.
Same thing with the Xenomorphs, their young takes some traits of the host, as a human-Xenomorph may have some human features, Predator-Xenomorphs are very hardy, and have the predator's strange looking-mouth, animal-Xenomorphs walk on four legs like all the time.
The insect-like aliens from Xcom, they tend to inject humans with their eggs, the humans become zombies before exploding from the insect-like alien's young bursting out.
Even the Zerg from starcraft, they like to infest others against their will, and usually turn some of them into kamikaze soldiers.
Or the Necromorphs from dead space, they kill the target, then proceed to infect them and turn them into more necromorphs.
Or the Blacklight Virus Undead from Prototype, they infest and create more zombies to kill and infect everyone.
It's not really an original idea....

============

The Shadow Boss, wearing a helmet to cover his face from the public, was wheeled into the Police Station from an underground path.

Police Chief: Oh, it's you. What do you want this time?

Shadow Boss: I have something that could assist your police officers greatly.

Police Chief: Yeah? Well spit it, A bunch of my boys just died yesterday and we're underhanded right now.

Shadow Boss: I offer to you, new bullet-proof body armor, straight from the factory line.

Police Chief: You're not giving this to us out of charity, are you.

Shadow Boss: I'll give this armor to your boys, in exchange, you overlook any crime from Crossbow Industries.

Police Chief: A bribe? You're gonna need more then bodyarmor for my boys.

Shadow Boss: Yes, that's why I'm also offering up these new HUD glasses and helmets, they shall greatly assist you, from thrown objects, and for communication.

Police Chief: It's a deal, we take those new toys, and you get to walk free.

Shadow Boss: Very good.

The Shadow Boss is wheeled out of the room.

EoNightcore

John was wheeled through the secret passage from the Police Station to Arms Development, again. This time, he was here to inspect the new projects. As he walked in, one of his Engineers noticed him.

Engineer: Sir! You're here!

Shadow Boss: Yes, I am. Now tell me, what do you have for me?

Engineer: Sir, we present to you...

They walked through a door to reveal a large machine, a large piloted machine.

Engineer: That Mark III Goliath. The Mark I was the Prototype, but it required too much power, and the Mark II is the base of the Mark III. The Mark III is equipped with several things the Mark II did not have, such as a HUDs display, a new engine, and a electric generator. It is also equipped to be faster then the Mark II. It is also equipped with new prototype shielding technology, however, it's still a prototype mind you. It's cockpit has also been reinforced with metal from the usual Mark II, which had bullet-proof glass. As such, the outside world is seen from Cameras, which transmits data to the cockpit. Well, what do you think sir?

Shadow Boss: You talk alot.

Engineer: I know, it's just that I'm so excited to unveil our newest technology.

Shadow Boss: Very well, continue on.

John left the room, his Secretary pushing his wheelchair.

============

Goliath MK I - Prototype, took too much power to operate. Deemed a failure.
Goliath MK II - Success, however quite simple design compared to MK III. Some of them are in the Police Armory, because of a previous deal between Crossbow Technologies and Industries, with the Police Chief a few years earlier. Most belong to the Military.

He enters after unlocking it with his keys, then sits in his comfy chair and begins to unpack the black bag.

[8356287]

Jessica: Let me out of here, you bastard!

Steve: Sure thing, Sugarcakes. I'll just let you go so you can run to the cops and tell 'em all about it. Nah, on second thought, why don't you just stay here with me, like a good little pet. What's wrong? Don't like your cage?

Steve bent down and leered at her through the bars. She spit in his face. He jerked back and then kicked the cage, knocking her off balance. She fell backward and hit her head.

Jessica: Ow!

He wiped the spit off his face and flicked it back toward the cage.

Steve: You need to learn some manners, young lady. Hey, you're an animal trainer - why don't you train yourself to quit being such a bitch!

Jessica glared up at him defiantly. His snarl cracked into a crooked grin and he turned around and slowly walked up the stairs, whistling a tune. He shut off the lights and slammed the door.

Jessica was alone, in a cage, in a very dark cellar.

[5367939]

bewwww The man turns off the t.v. after a few wordless songs play.

The man then picks up the clothes that have been organized, and makes a larger pile.

socks,
pants,
then underwear,
then shirts.

He puts them away in a large drawer. He opens a closet and silently changes into a military looking uniform. In fact, it looks like a uniform a jet pilot would wear.

He locks up the house, from the inside, then wanders to his bathroom. With a soft whoosh the bathroom begins to descend like an elevator. The man steps out when it finally reaches bottom. whoosh the bathroom ascends once more.

The man silently walks into a dark hallway, not a light to be seen. little did he know, another was in darkness, but a much worse kind
On july 12, 2014
[8356287]

Steve finished shaving and rinsed off his straight razor. He wiped it dry and placed it in the glass beside the sink. He loved that razor. So shiny, and sharper than a knife. There's just something sexy about that, he thought.

Then he made himself some pancakes - big, fluffy ones, with lots of butter and real maple syrup. He ate slowly and deliberately, cutting little wedges from the stack, stabbing them with the fork, slathering them with extra syrup from the plate, and chewing each bite exactly 20 times before swallowing. He washed it down with a tall glass of milk, then stood up and put on his suede jacket and ball cap.

Stepping out the door, he squinted in the bright sunlight. He donned some shades from his jacket pocket and locked the door behind him.

[Going to bed in rl soon, while the idea is fresh in my mind... i will post more]

The man wanders through the utter darkness for a period of time, it's almost like he has done this before

Unseeing, he reaches out his hand almost instinctively. It contacts cool, smooth metal.

Man: "Helllooo Firefly, i hope your ready to soar my sweet."

As the man slowly traces the curves of the jet with his hand, light slowly begins to spill into the room from outside. A huge hangar door is slowly opening.

As the man's eyes re-adjust to the light spilling in, he reaches the cockpit, and climbs in once the door is fully open.

flick, flick Switches are turned on, a helmet is put on, engines begin to purr, pre-flight checks are conducted.

KRZT "Firefly to spuds tower, im warming up over." KRZT
KRZT "Spuds tower to Firefly, you are go for launch." KRZT
KRZT "Roger that spuds tower, Firefly is launching!" KRZT

The jet engines get louder as it gains speed, exiting the hangar, it continues down the runway and achieves takeoff. Soon, it vanishes into the clouds above.

[8356287]

Truck driver: Alright, you're loaded up and good to go. Sign here.

The trailer was secured aboard the freighter plane, with seal in tact. Steve took the pad and scribbled his name. He glanced at the cargo manifest.

Steve: Potato chips? Heh. At least I'll save a few bucks on fuel.

Kinda boring though, he thought. Wish they could all be like that LAST mission! Well, gotta pay the bills somehow...

He climbed into the cockpit, closed the cargo bay doors, and fired up the engines.

Dispatcher: You're clear for take-off, Steve. Watch out for hostile activity near the city center. No-fly zone, check your nav. And please, no crazy stunts - boss said you'd get fired next time.

Steve: Yeah, uh... roger that.

Steve rolled his eyes and taxied out to the runway. Within minutes, he was airborne, staring at the blinking dot on the nav system, indicating his destination at a warehouse on the outskirts. His eyes were irresistibly drawn toward the red region surrounding the city center.

...Hostile activity? Now that sounds interesting! Maybe this trip won't be so boring after all.

He reprogrammed his flight-plan to pass just outside the no-fly zone.
On july 12, 2014
[8356287]

Jessica was getting hungry, and the ropes were hurting her wrists. She wiggled her arms to try to get some blood-flow back into her hands, which were almost numb behind her back. Her arm brushed across a bulge in her pocket, and she remembered the elephant treats she was carrying.

Jessica: Oh, thank GOD! I'd eat ANYTHING at this point...

She squirmed around for a few minutes and eventually managed to get one of the fibrous lumps out of her pocket.

Jessica: Great, now how the hell am I supposed to get it in my mouth?

She dropped it on the floor of the cage and let herself fall sideways so she could try to wiggle herself around toward it.

squeak-SQUEAK... squeak-squeak SQUEEEK!

Jessica froze. She knew that sound. As a biologist and animal-lover, she was quite fond of most creatures, but she HATED rats. Even as experimental test subjects in the lab, she could hardly stand to be around them unless they were confined in cages. And now, SHE was in a cage, and a rat was running free out there in the darkness. But she was oblivious to the irony, and shuddered in terror at the sound of its tiny feet scampering toward her.

On july 13, 2014
EoNightcore

You guys know what? Time is moving too fast here! We need to calm it down! Especially you Manuel, you remind me of me sometimes when I was still little me and not me right now.

Right, so New (experimental) rules, first off, NOT TOO MANY OP CHARACTERS, second off, ONLY FOUR-SIX PEOPLE PER X-COM SQUAD, third off, THE BIGGER YOUR PARTY, THE MORE YOU'RE CONTROLLING AN ARMY THEN CONTROLLING A PC, KILL OFF SOMEONE OR MAKE THEM GO NPC, fourth off, IF YOU'RE SOMEONE WHO HAS A TENDENCY TO POST SEVERAL THINGS SEVERAL TIMES, THEN MAKE YOUR POST ONE LONG POST UNTIL A DECISION ROLL OR SOMETHING!, fifth off, YOU NOW HAVE A LIMIT POST OF TWO POSTS FOR ANY PART OF THE STORY UNTIL ANOTHER PERSON POSTS, ANYTHING BEYOND THAT WILL BE HAPPENING IN AN ALTERNATE TIMELINE, BUT NOT OURS.

========================

The Shadow Boss watched from a camera the scene unfolding before him, people shooting, aliens shooting, people dying, more aliens dying then people. And all in all, the technology he created going in a faster rate then normal.

Something was improving x-com's Technology yes, but whatever it was, it wasn't from Crossbow Technologies, and it wasn't from the X-com labs, because most of the X-com labs was Crossbow Technologies.

Shadow Boss: Shall I pull out funds from the X-com Project? No, no, not until they prove untrustworthy.

The Screen Flickered, before him appeared the X-com Commander, and the council, only the X-com leader was in a lit room.

???1: Hello Commander, I see progress has been good, but your actions can be improved. You have only been reacting to several small events, and several major cities around the globe are starting to panic.

???2: It also seems your troops are becoming more like your private army then Humanity's Defenders, as you appear to be creating an army instead of several elite squads.

Shadow Boss: Commander Manuel, I know you wish to beat the alien scum back to outer space, but please remember the X-Com soldiers are not your private army. If you do attempt to make them your private army, I will have to cut funding for X-Com

???4: You have earned a report of B-, as the aliens seem to be rather inactive, but remember.

???1: We are always watching.

The screen flickered, and the council logged off.
On july 13, 2014
[8356287]

Respectfully, I must agree with shadowlake and EoNightcore. This isn't a video game, it's a story. If you have the biggest guns and win all the battles, the story is actually pretty lame. This is starting to smell like the other thread, with constantly escalating power struggles between massively over-powered characters. Guns and bombs and monsters are fun, up to a point, but eventually it just gets dumb. Can we try to let go of this idea of "winning" and instead just write a cool story? Maybe even a funny story? Do something silly and foolish!

EoNightcore

The Shadow Boss was rolled down the loooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooong dark passage, to the X-Com labs, someone was improving their technology too fast, and while this was helpful, the Shadow Boss wasn't keen on helping X-Com too much.

Too much power in the X-Com's hands would reduce Crossbow Technologies to nothing more then their puppet, something John could not allow. If X-Com took over Crossbow Technologies, then Earth would become theirs, they would become something akin to a Federation.

John: Say, Merial?

Merial (Shadow Secretary): yes John?

John: Your brothers, they're still living in Europa aren't they?

Merial: Yes Sir.

John: On second thought, Merial, bring me to the Hanger. I'm going to give your people a new home.

Merial: Really Sir?

John: Hey, you think I lie?

Merial and John went back down the Loooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooong Passage, and into another path to the Hangers.

The Shadow Boss wasn't going to let X-Com control everything without his permission, as he was the fifth council member.
On july 13, 2014
[8356287]

Steve: Holy smokes!! They were right, it's an all out WAR over there!

He thought about veering away to safety, but then he got an idea. He engaged the auto-pilot and ran back to the cargo bay. He busted the seal off the trailer and swung the doors open. Inside was a single gigantic plastic encasement around loose bulk potato chips.

Steve: They're not even bagged! Oh hell yes, this is gonna be great!!

He sliced the plastic open and the chips spilled out onto the floor. Then he ran over to the side hatch, braced himself, unlatched it and threw it open. Wind blasted into the cargo bay, and the chips started swirling through the air, smashing into little bits. Giggling madly, he raced back to the cockpit.

Steve: Auto-pilot OFF! Altitude UP!!

He climbed and climbed until he was far above the fray, then headed straight for the center of the no-fly zone. He knew he'd lose his job for this (and maybe even get arrested), but in his mind, it was totally worth it. Just above the battle, he hit that Big Red Button again, and the rear cargo bay doors opened up.

POTATO CHIPS!

POTATO CHIPS EVERYWHERE!!!!!

Versatio

Steve: Holy smokes!! They were right, it's an all out WAR over there!

He thought about veering away to safety, but then he got an idea. He engaged the auto-pilot and ran back to the cargo bay. He busted the seal off the trailer and swung the doors open. Inside was a single gigantic plastic encasement around loose bulk potato chips.

Steve: They're not even bagged! Oh hell yes, this is gonna be great!!

He sliced the plastic open and the chips spilled out onto the floor. Then he ran over to the side hatch, braced himself, unlatched it and threw it open. Wind blasted into the cargo bay, and the chips started swirling through the air, smashing into little bits. Giggling madly, he raced back to the cockpit.

Steve: Auto-pilot OFF! Altitude UP!!

He climbed and climbed until he was far above the fray, then headed straight for the center of the no-fly zone. He knew he'd lose his job for this (and maybe even get arrested), but in his mind, it was totally worth it. Just above the battle, he hit that Big Red Button again, and the rear cargo bay doors opened up.

POTATO CHIPS!

POTATO CHIPS EVERYWHERE!!!!!

Switches are flipped again to change radio settings
KRZT "Echo to Firefly, we got unauthorized company by way of cargo plane." KRZT
KRZT "Copy that Echo, take care of the UFO, i'm on it." KRZT
KRZT "Copy that Firefly." KRZT

The jet flies for a small time, jets are fast.
switches for radio settings flipped again
KRZT This is military 1 to cargo plane, i'll be frank. What the hell are you doing? KRZT

EoNightcore

John's Private Plane launched, and besides them was several new Demon-Hunter Fighter Jets(to ward off UFOs and other human fighter jets), and several commercial jets. John was going to bring home a bunch of Elves to the the forest in England.

Merial came into John's private room, dressed as an airplane attendant.

John: Merial? I didn't know you have a fascination for dressing up.

Merial: Sir, I... I actually wished to tell you my feelings....

John: Really? Well, we better get some private time then.

John clicked some switches, and the door closed.

The Pilot didn't know what was going to go on between the Elvish Lady and his Boss, but if there was one thing he knew, it was that his Boss was probably going to join the Mile-High Club.

Suddenly, the clouds parted, and the heavens opened up, and the God of Peace reached his hand down, and a warm glow emanated outward from it. All bombs and bullets fizzled as duds, and all hand-held weapons instantly melted - but it was a cool melt, so it didn't hurt anyone. The hand pulled back up into the sky, and the clouds returned. All those people standing around on the roof-tops looked pretty silly holding melted guns in their hands, with potato chips raining on their heads.

On july 13, 2014
[8356287]

She could hear it chewing. Nibble nibble nibble.... It stayed there, right beside the cage, eating the treat while she just listened. Eventually, her tight muscles loosened up, and she sort of got used to it being there. Not comfortable, but not quite so afraid.

Then she had a thought: What's worse? A rat, or that psycho? Who knows what he was going to do to her... She had to get out of here somehow. If only she could get these ropes off...

She squirmed around again and took another treat from her pocket, then she tried to get the rat's attention: Tk tk tk

The chewing sound stopped.

It scuffled closer toward her, but she didn't move. A shiver went up her spine as it crawled onto her hands, but she summoned the will-power to not jerk away from it. She slowly brought the treat up toward the ropes and rubbed it across them, then gripped it tightly in her hand. The rat sniffed around on her hands for several unnerving seconds...
On july 13, 2014

21-50 the rat bites her
51-100 the rat starts gnawing on the ropes

[8337275]

Sleep is overrated, more story must be told.

The party wanders through the forest, eventually coming to an abandoned log cabin.
Captain: Crew, explore the house!
Pathfinder: I've got a bad feeling about this...
Preacher: My gods say we'll be fine.
Doctor: Does anyone else thing this is-
Psychologist: Funny? Yes. Captain, are you sure?
Captain: Yes, I'm-
Technician: Well, in that case-

The Technician walks inside, and everyone stares calmly at the door.
Technician: Lots of Food! And a sink, so Water! Come on in!
Everyone runs inside, bolting the door to block out the night, which seemed to be falling.
Captain: If this world is like ours, we need to cover those windows!
Doctor: See those fabric strips? Those are what the humans call curtains. Primitive, huh?
A Loud crack is heard, and outside of a yet uncovered window lies a-

1-20:Nothing. It was purely imagination.
21-40:Hunter, with a bolt-action rifle.
41-60:Zombie, with very sharp teeth and claws
61-80:Mankarog, fresh from the local zoo.
81-100: Angry god, to punish the unbelievers.

Sleep is overrated, more story must be told.

The party wanders through the forest, eventually coming to an abandoned log cabin.
Captain: Crew, explore the house!
Pathfinder: I've got a bad feeling about this...
Preacher: My gods say we'll be fine.
Doctor: Does anyone else thing this is-
Psychologist: Funny? Yes. Captain, are you sure?

Technician: Well, in that case-

The Technician walks inside, and everyone stares calmly at the door.
Technician: Lots of Food! And a sink, so Water! Come on in!
Everyone runs inside, bolting the door to block out the night, which seemed to be falling.

The Shadow Boss landed back in England.

X-Com could not be trusted, this much was true. As such, he was going to ensure that life on Earth was defended from any menace. John looked at the cage, inside it was someone, something that tried to kill him.

John: Tell me, what are you?

Mush: Foolish Humans! The Mush listen to no fool that becomes their meal!

John: Really now? Well, it doesn't matter, because "We Have Ways" of knowing what you know.

Mush: Hissssssssssssss

John: Take him away.

The cage was taken away.

John: Now, Merial? When shall we announce the wedding? The world needs a bit more happiness after the depressing events that happened recently. Alien Invasion, Random Kidnappings, Terrorist Attacks.

Merial: I do believe, we should announce it a week from now, at the new showing of your latest creation.

John: Yes....

John looked on as a strange mech, that was not a Goliath, was seen testing out it's laser weapons at a testing range.

As such, presents!

To the Mankarog, I give Chitin Armored Plating as Natural Armor!

To X-Com, I give out the schematics for the Goliath Class Mechs, oh, and a new member, rank: Sergeant, class: Sniper, feel free to name him, just make sure not to insult nature, he's quite sensitive about that... *whispers* He's an Elf.

To the group of travelers who once doubted a GOD, I give the Bible of GOD, with the ability to give out blessings and curses, but only a limit of 3 (for both Curses and Blessings, meaning only one curse and two blessings, vice versa, or whatever) Blessings/Curses per real-time day.

To Exalt, I'm unlocking their elite troops, Lawl, see how X-Com likes those apples!

To Crossbow Industries... Well, I am Crossbow Industries....

To Steve, I shall give him the ability to walk through walls.

To Jessica, I set free, the EXALT troops are just right outside though.

To the Military, I give out Laser Weapons.

To the Officers, I give a Knight-Mech, because screw Physics.

To my own PCs, I give my happy blessings.

X-Com has multiple bases across the world, their main HQ is hidden.

Crossbow Engineer: Sir, we present to you, the latest in our technology.

The Engineer proceeded to reveal several new inventions.

Crossbow Engineer: X-Com may have the edge over us in weapons and armor manufacture, but they forget, we supply several things to them, and thus, we also have some of their schematics. Sir, I present to you, the Siege Tank!

Before the Engineer was a Tank. shooting at a range.

Shadow Boss: It's just a tank....

Crossbow Engineer: This tank may look like a regular tank, but it is in fact, both artillery, and tank.

The Siege Tank proceeded to transform into another mode, and proceeded to wipe the targets on the range forever off the land.

Shadow Boss: Impressive, closing the gap between artillery and tank.

Shadow Secretary: Oh my god....

Crossbow Engineer: We also proceed to this next one, which the Arms Departments has decided to call, the Viking.

Before them was another Mech.

Crossbow Technician: Allright! Try transforming!

The Viking proceeded to jump into the air and transform into an airplane, except it floated, instead of flying off like airplanes usually do.

Shadow Boss: This, this will change the face of warfare.

Crossbow Engineer: That's out newest invention, but we're planning to plan more.

Shadow Boss: Show me this... more

The group proceeded to look over the countryside.

Crossbow Engineer: Using the cloaking technology form X-Com's research into the Ghost Armor, we have created a cloaking field, a huge one, which requires alot of power. We're going to need this power, if we're going to build this thing.

Before them, something big, something huge was being built.

Crossbow Engineer: We're just leveling the playing field... with the aliens.

[8356287]

Walter, the Health Inspector, was shaking his head, with a disturbed and angry look on his face. His toupee was cocked sideways, and his thin mustache twitched. He wheeled around and slammed through the kitchen door out into the dining room, with a nervous restaurant manager right behind him.

Walter: This is beyond unacceptable. The only thing that passed my inspection was the gosh-darned soda machine. Those spoiled Alien Steaks are just egregious, and I couldn't even identify that stuff you put in your "special sauce." By the authority of the Federation Health Department, I'm shutting this place down.

Several customers overheard this, and immediately stopped chewing. With disgust, they spit out the "food" onto their plates and stormed out of the diner. One of them keeled over and barfed on the floor.

Just then, a team of strange-looking individuals burst into the restaurant with large weapons. One of them even wielded TWO of the huge guns, and began blasting them around the diner.

Walter: WHOA, WHOA!!! ....Say, are you guys from the Enforcement branch of the Department? How did you know? I haven't even reported yet!

[8356287]

Walter was crouched down with his hands over his bald head, and his toupee on the floor. He stood up and straightened his glasses, shaking the debris off his shoulders.

Walter: This is highly unusual. Normally we don't call in a demolition squad for a first infraction. Who authorized this? Never mind, I'd better report this right away.

He took a walkie-talkie from his belt, cupped his hand around it, and began speaking quietly, staring sideways at the team, with one eyebrow raised.

Then he noticed another man, still sitting at his table, peacefully sipping a clear sparkling beverage.

On july 13, 2014
[8356287]

Steve fumbled around until he found a doorknob. It was locked. He felt up toward the light switch and flipped it on.

He was in an armory. Racks of guns and munitions lined the walls, and a large chest was sitting in the corner. Steve lit up like a kid in a candy store.

Steve: Oh hell yes! I ain't goin' to jail, I'd rather die in a blaze of glory!

He grabbed the biggest gun he could see.

Steve: OOF! Damn, that's heavy....

He dropped it on the floor and then stuffed a pair of pistols down his pants, a knife in his boot, an assault rifle over his shoulder, and two extra magazines in his jacket. He tried to open the chest, but it was locked. He flipped up the lapel of his suede jacket and put his shades back on, feeling like a real bad-ass.

Then he looked back toward the door. He knew it was locked, but tried it again anyway. It was still locked. He stepped back and gave it a hard kick, but it was hard as a brick wall, and he crumpled to the floor and clutched his foot in pain.

Then he slowly stood up, hopping on his good leg. He turned around and looked at the place where he thought he entered the room. It was a solid wall covered in weapons. He stood there with his jaw slacked open, trying to figure it out, but then noticed a row of key hooks, with four rings of keys hanging on them. One of them had about a dozen keys on it, but the rest only had two or three. He looked back at the door, but it had no keyhole. He fumbled through the keys and spotted a small one, the size of the keyhole on the chest. He stuffed the other keys in his pockets.

He turned the key, and the chest opened. It was packed with boxes of grenades, plastic explosives, detonators and timers, multi-spectrum goggles, and a strange head-mount device with electrodes extending outward in a semi-spherical starburst pattern.

Salivating over all the power, he clipped as much gear as would fit onto his belt: 5 grenades, two bombs, a timer and a remote detonator. He put the goggles on his face and looked around the room, which was now a rainbow of infrared heat signatures and ultraviolet smudges.

Steve: AWESOME!!

Then he looked back toward the strange device. Whatever it was, it must be good. He put it on.

A sharp PAIN spiked into his head, followed by an overwhelming flood of information. He couldn't make sense of it at first, but then he realized that he could visualize a map of the building and surrounding areas. The map was centered on a small room, and he knew it was the armory he was in. He focused his thoughts on the hallway just outside, and he instantly saw an image projected into his mind from a camera on the hall ceiling. The hallway was empty, except for some chunks of concrete scattered across the floor, and the opposite wall had a massive hole in it.

The image receded, and he was looking at the map again. Several regions of the map were blacked out. He tried to focus in on one of them, but then he heard a female voice in his head: Access Code Required.

Stumped, he took off the device, feeling another sharp pain as he did. He took off the goggles and shook his head.

Steve: Man, that's intense.... I LIKE IT!!!

Jessica shook the frayed remains of the ropes from her wrists, then pulled her robe back over her. She untied her knees and ankles and stood up, looking down at the dog, who was panting proudly beside her.

Jessica: AHEM. Uh... Good dog. I wish I had some treats for you, but I doubt you'd like elephant food.

She knelt down and scratched Lily behind the ears. Lily rolled onto her back, and Jessica stroked her belly.

Then she stood up, rubbing her sore wrists, and addressed the strangely silent soldiers at the top of the stairs.

Jessica: Thank you. I'm sorry I was so... impatient. It's just that I... I haven't eaten in two days. My back is cramped and there was this stupid RAT that.... well, anyway, can I please have something to eat now?

She approached the stairs, still unsure of their intentions.

On july 13, 2014
[8356287]

Harry Maubrick, president of Maubrick Holdings, LLC., was pacing furiously around his office. The Selectively Programmable Operant Reconditioning Electro-Stimulators (SPORES) had been a complete failure. Only the janitor had responded to their remote commands, but he was legally retarded and was unable to perform even the simplest tasks. So much for their plans of secretly taking control of the 5 largest corporations in Sol....

What made him even angrier was the fact that he couldn't even blame his idiot assistant for screwing up the plan. Suddenly he realized: it was sabotage.

Maubrick: CROSSBOW! They must have suspected what we were planning and slipped us some defective SPORES! OOHHHHHH! "Strategic Alliance" my ass.

He punched the intercom.

Maubrick: Fitzgerald! In my office, NOW!

Intercom: R-right away, sir.

The short assistant rushed into the room.

Maubrick: How much stock do I own in Crossbow Industries?

Fitzgerald answered from memory, without hesitation.

Fitzgerald: Four billion, seventy-six million, eight-hundred forty thousand shares, sir. That's 34% of total shares.

Maubrick slowly grinned....

Maubrick: Good, good... Fitzgerald, I have another assignment for you. I hereby order you to sell everything else, and buy up every single share of CRSBW on the market, at any price. ANY PRICE, you understand? You get me a controlling interest in that company, and I'll make you a Junior Partner!

The assistant beamed.

Fitzgerald: Really, sir? Oh, that would be - I... YES SIR! I'm on it!

On july 13, 2014
EoNightcore

At last, it was complete.
Crossbow Technologies, and Industries would have a new part added to it. The Crossbow Military.

The Project was a success, as the station in space was in fact a construction statoin, and Crossbow was going to create Capital Ships, as those seen only in Video Games.

They had the blueprints, they had the materials, and now, they had the factory neccessary to build it. Even better was that the aliens were busy invading the Cities.

London was going to be defended by new Crossbow Military Forces. As such, London did not need to be saved by X-Com and as such, the Shadow Boss could hide his forces out in England, as England was now his.

Exalt was a pain in the ass, but could be taken care of, X-Com was another pain in the ass, but was useful.

The Shadow Boss looked over his army, an army consisting of Mechs, Infantry and Siege tanks. And he smiled. The Aliens wouldn't know what hit them.

Jessica had no intention of going with those goons. She looked around the room and spotted a straight razor by the sink, which she stuffed in her robe pocket. The Screens Flickered

???1: Yes John? What do you require?

John: The X-Com project hasn't been going as planned, therefore I suggest something.

???1: What?

John: We shall incorporate the X-Com project into our militaries.

???2: What do you mean? Militaries?

John: Oh come on, I know what you have a private Military at your beck and call, we all do. The Alien Threat is too much work for X-Com, therefore considering our position in the world, we should split up the defense of the world into 5 parts.

???1: Very interesting, continue.

John: My HQ is located in Europa, therefore I can defend the entirety of Europa, and the Middle East.

???1: Very well then, considering my location, I shall defend North America, and the northern part of Central America.

???2: Fine, I'll defend South America, and the South part of Central America.

???3: I shall defend Asia.

???4: Africa shall be mine then.

???1: But who will defend the Islands of the oceans?

John: I will.

???2: You're defending Europa! Europa is nowhere near the Pacific!

John: Yes, unless Toshiba Company would like to defend at least a third of the world by themselves?

???3: That... would be unpleasant.

???1: Crossbow Industries will defend the Northern-western part of Asia, as well as their original areas. In exchange, the African Royal Company will defend the Middle East.

???4: Fine

???1: As such, this meeting is over.

???1, 3, and 4's screen flickered off.

???2: Remember John, remember, we are always watching. And one day, everything you have, will be mine.

John: I doubt it, you never could let go of that grudge, could you.

???2's screen flicked off.

John: Dumbass cousin of mine. You aren't the rightful owner of this company.

Current price for shares of CRSBW: 30 + 60 credits

Number of shares currently available: (48 + 79) * 10 million shares

Maubrick account balance: dice rolled in private chat with shadowlake to remain secret

Fitzgerald buys everything he can.

Steve heard jet engines screaming by above the building, and gun fire blasting just outside.

Steve: Damn, now what?!

He pulled the brain interface back onto his head and gritted his teeth as the shock spiked through his nervous system. He focused his thoughts on the runway just outside, and saw the battle unfolding from the camera on the roof. He pulled his mind away and his natural vision returned.

It was time to get out of here, NOW. He stepped back to the far wall and aimed his assault rifle at the (heavily reinforced) armory door.

1-3 he blasts it off its hinges

1-20 being struck by lightning

61-80 his parents having sex

48

[8356287]

The doors swing open into Maubrick's office. A man in a suit, flanked by two armed guards, strides into the room, followed by Maubrick's assistant.

Fitzgerald: I tried to stop them, sir!

The man in the suit flashed a badge.

Suit: I'm Agent Hackney with the Federation Financial Security Department. Are you Harry Maubrick?

Maubrick: ......Yes. Yes, I am.

Agent Hackney: Mr. Maubrick, you are under arrest for fraudulent insider trading. We've been following your activity very closely for months. Now that you've made your move on Crossbow, we've got all the evidence we need. Sergeant, please take Mr. Maubrick into custody.

Maubrick: But - but I can explain! Wait, you don't understand! This is all a mistake DO YOU HEAR ME? You'll be hearing from my lawyers!!!

And with that, Maubrick's life was officially over. The FFSD siezed his assets and sold off all his stocks. CRSBW crashed down to a measly 13 credits, taking the entire market down with it. Sol was now in a depression. Investors defenestrated, ad infinitum, et cetera.....

On july 14, 2014
[8356287]

Jessica blinked twice. The attic looked like a tornado had been through it. Boxes were dumped over and smashed open. Broken pieces of furniture were scattered across the heaps of junk. Bits and pieces of Steve's past lay strewn and exposed before her. It was tempting to look through it, but time was against her.

She tip-toed to the stairs and peeked down into the hallway. It was empty. She climbed down the stairs and looked around. Steve's home was surprisingly home-like... for a psycho. (Never mind the pyramid of cheap beer cans beside the TV, and the poster of a fighter jet above the couch.) She cautiously explored her way into the kitchen. Still no sight of those military goons.

But right there on the table was a plate of half-eaten pancakes, dried out and crusty around the edges, and it looked like the most delicious thing she had ever seen in her entire life. She snatched up the top pancake and the entire stack came with it. She stuffed it in her mouth and snarfed it down, moaning with pleasure.

Jessica: Hmmmph, SOO GOOOD!

She heard a radio chirp just outside, and the sound of the front door opening. She quickly opened the pantry door and squeezed inside, quietly closing it behind her. Footsteps entered the kitchen and stopped. A burp slipped out of her mouth.

Steve: YES!!

He ran back into the interrogation room, using the door like a normal person without weird powers. He called up the mental map and scanned the layout of the facility. Those blacked-out areas of the map were really interesting, but he had no idea where he could find the "access code." Then he spotted what looked like some kind of hangar or large equipment bay. He focused in on it and saw a half-disassembled giant robot thingy. Looked pretty cool, but useless in this state. There was also a small jet in one corner. He couldn't tell if it was functional, but decided that was his best bet.

Zooming back out to the map, he quickly noted the path to get there, then rushed out of the interrogation room, with rifle at the ready.

[8356287]

So this interstellar ship of yours... by any chance is it named Daedalus? (So the thread title can finally make sense?)

Steve would make a pretty good stow-away. Kind of like... oh - Stephen! Haha, I didn't even plan that. Shady dude on the run... Huh, he kidnapped a girl too! And he likes to cook! (Pancakes, at least.) I swear this is all complete coincidence.

I'm somewhat concerned about splitting the plot-line up into separate parts that can hardly interact. The story is already pretty fractured, and this would practically create another "alternate timeline" where half the characters are just completely isolated from the other half. What would you guys think about having all or most of our characters get on this ship, so that the story will actually focus on the "Daedalus" (if indeed that is its name)? I think this would be really helpful for us writing the story, to have everybody together, instead of scattered throughout all these separate vignettes. Then we can do a lot more role-play and share the same experiences together, which will be a lot more fun than each of us lurking in our own little dark corners of the story. What do you say? Can we weave this thing together?

Jessica is kind of like Finola. Shadowlake's pilot is like Roland. It was already mentioned that John is similar to Gioele. Misterme7's lawyer Bob is a sleuth like Eleesha. DrWinner has a technician, an "only hope", and an interesting mix of other characters with some overlap to the canon characters. Harrivchan had a Dan character that we never got to know, so he could easily fit in anywhere. I really think this could work out great! What do you think?

[8356287]

Oh yeah... Well, we could re-write that history a bit if you want. That was back when we were stuck in the chaos of an endless shoot-em-up video game, so I wouldn't mind seeing some of that nonsense get purged from the plot. But that's up to you.

I'm not saying that we should try to make our characters fill the roles of the canon characters, I just mean that their traits and abilities have a similar diversity that would work well together.

If we do this, I think we should not try to make any of our characters Mush. That only works when the game mechanics preserve the suspense, but it would quickly become obvious who is sabotaging stuff when we're writing a story together. It seems like we'd need some other central conflict to drive the story. I don't have any ideas for that, though... So far the ship's main purpose is an Elf exodus.

On july 14, 2014
[8356287]

shadowlakeThe military men gather in the room. A medic follows, tending to the fallen military man # 1

Military man: "This is the U.S. Military, we have reason to believe there is a captive here!"

"If you are nearby, please come out slowly!"

Jessica wan't sure what to think. Were these the same military goons that were trying to hunt her down in the attic? The razor quivered in her hand. She had literally brought a knife to a gun fight, and she knew she didn't stand a chance. They obviously knew she was here, and it was just a matter of time before they opened the pantry. She didn't have much choice.

Jessica: I... I'm in here. I'm coming out. Please don't shoot me. I don't know why everybody is after me, I just want to get home.

Jessica opened the pantry door, still holding the razor in front of her, eyes wide with apprehension.

These soldiers looked different. Their uniforms were different, and their faces weren't covered. She slowly lowered the razor and her arms hung limp at her sides.

Jessica: Who were those guys? What do they want with ME? I'm just an elephant trainer. Or at least, I WAS, until that idiot kidnapped me and dropped poor Bubbles and Sunshine out his damn plane, for god knows what crazy reason.... I swear, if I ever get a hold of that bastard-

Soldier: Exalt.

Jessica: Excuse me?

Soldier: You asked who they were. They're members of a rogue military force called Exalt. We don't know who they're working for, but it's clear that you are a high-profile target. We captured the freighter pilot and were interrogating him at one of our bases. Exalt attacked the base, and must have tracked you down here from the identification markings on his plane.

Jessica: Wait, wait... I don't get it. This psycho kidnaps me, then some mysterious rogue military wants to kidnap me, then you guys come to save me - why am I so important?

Soldier: Why don't we have a seat.

He picked up the table and two chairs, sitting in one of them. Jessica hesitated for a moment and then sat down. She was so exhausted and confused....

Soldier: I'm Captain Jevon Briggs.

Jessica: Uhh... Jessica Helmsley.

Briggs: Yes, I know. I read your dossier. It's nice to meet you in person.

Jessica: ....Okay? It's... nice to meet you too, I guess.

Briggs: Our intel suggests that your doctoral thesis work might be of interest to certain individuals.

Jessica couldn't help but laugh in amazement.

Jessica: You're kidding, right? It's not like there was anything ground-breaking about it. My advisor even told me I should pick a different thesis. I don't know why I stuck with it, I just thought it was... fascinating. But I've regretted it ever since. None of the journals would even publish it. I got turned down for every decent job I applied to. My student loans were overdue, and I had to take this bit as an elephant trainer at the zoo just to make ends meet. Now you're telling me that "certain individuals" are trying to hunt me down because they're "interested" in my work? I'm not buying it.

Briggs: Honestly, Ma'am, we're not sure either. The only thing we know for certain is that you are in danger. I've been tasked with assuring your safety.

Jessica: It's "Miss," not "Ma'am."

Briggs: ...My apologies. Miss Helmsley, the Secretary of Science and Technology would like to meet with you personally.

Jessica: ...Look, I've been tied up in a cage for the past two days with nothing to eat. My cat is probably out of water by now. Can I please just go home?

Briggs: Negative. Your home is a primary target, and we've seen Exalt units coming and going ever since you disappeared.

Jessica: WHAT? In my HOUSE?! Why didn't you stop them?!

Briggs: Our primary objective was to assure your safety. ...I will see to it that your cat is well cared for. We've got comfortable accommodations aboard the jet where you can rest and recuperate from this... ordeal.

Jessica: No. I'm not leaving her behind. She comes with me, or I'm not going - period.

Briggs: ...Very well. Lieutenant Jeffries, bring the cat here. Hurry, the transport is waiting.

Jeffries: Yes sir.

The Lieutenant stepped out the front door and spotted a suspicious looking individual. He quietly slipped back inside.

Jeffries: Sir, we've got company. A lone male, lurking around the corner of the house. Doesn't look like Exalt, but....

Briggs: Alonzo, Perry - take care of it. I'll stay and guard Miss Helmsley. Jeffries, proceed with your mission. GO!

Jeffries, Alonzo, and Perry: YES SIR!

(Woah, that was long. Sorry, I had to explain some stuff... And we needed a cat. )

On july 15, 2014
[8356287]

So Steve is back in the interrogation room. He just finished looking at the map and decided to head for the hangar. The path to get there goes through 4 areas (not counting the ones he's already been in, nor the destination):

1. big conference room
2. long hallway
3. wide alley between buildings
4. small warehouse / storage room

For each area, I'll make 2 rolls: Steve's effect on the environment, and the environment's effect on him.

Steve's effect on the environment:
1-20 no effect
21-40 he kills somebody
41-60 he kills 2 people
61-80 he destroys something
81-85 he saves somebody's life
86-100 (to be decided by another player, different for each area)

The environment's effect on him:
1 he gets killed
2-5 he gets knocked out
6-10 he gets hurt severely
11-20 he gets a moderate injury
21-50 he gets a minor injury
51-70 he finds something useful/valuable
71-85 no effect
86-100 (to be decided by another player, different for each area)


Then I'll write a short paragraph describing the outcome for each area.

So I'll need a total of 8 ideas from somebody else. You can give a list of those possibilities for all 4 areas in advance, or you can do them one at a time as I make the rolls. The latter might be more interesting...

On july 15, 2014
[8356287]

Out of the interrogation room and down the hallway, Steve dashed through a set of large double doors leading into a big conference room, filled with rows of chairs. He started to walk down one of the rows, when he suddenly heard a voice.

WELCOME!

Steve whirled madly in every direction trying the source of the voice. He stumbled over a chair and tried to catch himself, but hyper-extended his left hand backward with a sickening crunch.

Steve: AAAUUGH!!!!

He wallowed on the floor in pain, then noticed that a device on the ceiling was blinking. The voice continued:

Crossbow Industries is proud to present the latest advancement in Augmented Reality Facility Management. Our patented neural interface technology will give you the edge to maintain complete awareness and control, within the range of the installation. Perfect for Security, Maintenance, and Emergency Response, you'll have instant access to remotely monitor any area, through seamless integration with your existing surveillance, security, and fire-detection systems. Our Device Control Modules (sold separately) will give you control over any equipment that supports the CB-211 standard, which includes most of Crossbow's product line. You'll need a DCM on every device you want to control, but they're very budget-friendly! Please accept this prototype unit as a gift. If you find it useful, our sales representatives are standing by. Thank you for choosing Crossbow!

Steve's wrist was starting to swell up, and he couldn't move it. He got to his feet and continued down the row of chairs. He was at least thankful to have a better understanding of what this gadget could do...


Next up: a long hallway.... What might happen there? You decide!

On july 15, 2014
[8356287]

Steve reached the other side of the conference room and passed through another set of double doors into a long hallway.

A bullet grazed his leg!

Ten feet to his left was a wounded soldier lying in a pool of blood, with a pistol in his hand. Steve froze, but the man went limp and dropped the pistol. Steve jerked his rifle up and stared down the sights, finger on the trigger. He looked into the man's misty eyes for a few seconds, then lowered his weapon. He couldn't do it.

Soldier: Exalt! They got me! *gasp* Sorry I shot at you, I... I thought they were coming to finish me off.

Steve stood there speechless.

Soldier: Listen.... I don't know if I'm gonna make it. There's a medkit up there, but I... just can't...

Steve: ...Alright... Hold on.

Just beside the man was a shelving unit with an assortment of gear and medical supplies. He opened up the medkit and began to administer aid to the soldier.

Soldier: Thanks mister. I owe ya one....

Steve: This one's on me, buddy. ...Listen, can you take it from there? I'm kind of in a hurry.

Soldier: I think so... Yeah, I'll be alright. Thanks to you.

Steve nodded and stood up, then looked back toward the shelves. He rummaged through some pill bottles, then popped some OTC pain-killers and anti-inflammatories in his mouth before rushing onward down the hallway.

===

Coming up: a wide alley between buildings. 15% chance of what and what?

On july 15, 2014
[8356287]

Wounded Soldier: Hey! Wait!

Steve slowed and turned around, still walking backwards.

Soldier: Those guys are still out there - the ones who shot me up. They ambushed me from behind the dumpster. Watch your back!

Steve: I'll do that. Thanks for the tip!

Steve wheeled around again and approached a pair of glass doors leading outside. Steve looked out both sides of the door and saw a large dumpster just to the right of the door. He slowly pushed the door open and peeked out. No one was around. He quietly slipped out and gently closed the door behind him. Then he tip-toed around the side of the dumpster, jumped out and blasted away two hiding Exalt units. They never knew what hit 'em....

A swarm of jets were screaming through the skies above him, dancing in zig-zags and firing rockets at each other. He stared up in amazement at their incredible maneuvers, intensely jealous that he was stuck on the ground. That was the kind of action he has always dreamed about... He had to get to that jet!

Just across the way was a loading dock leading into a small warehouse attached to the side of the hangar. He was almost there.... He cautiously approached the dock and looked inside.

===

Wounded Soldier: Hey! Wait!

Steve slowed and turned around, still walking backwards.

Soldier: Those guys are still out there - the ones who shot me up. They ambushed me from behind the dumpster. Watch your back!

Steve: I'll do that. Thanks for the tip!

Steve wheeled around again and approached a pair of glass doors leading outside. Steve looked out both sides of the door and saw a large dumpster just to the right of the door. He slowly pushed the door open and peeked out. No one was around. He quietly slipped out and gently closed the door behind him. Then he tip-toed around the side of the dumpster, jumped out and blasted away two hiding Exalt units. They never knew what hit 'em....

A swarm of jets were screaming through the skies above him, dancing zig-zags around each other. He stared up in amazement at their incredible maneuvers, intensely jealous that he was stuck on the ground. That was the kind of action he has always dreamed about... He had to get to that jet!

Just across the way was a loading dock leading into a small warehouse attached to the side of the hangar. He was almost there.... He cautiously approached the dock and looked inside.

On july 15, 2014
[8356287]

He burst through the door into the hangar and slammed into a tool cart, flipping head over heels onto a disassembled engine, impaling his leg on a long steel rod.

He gasped. Every muscle in his body clenched and trembled, causing shockwaves of agony to rip through his mind. The painkillers hadn't hit yet, and they wouldn't have helped much anyway. He almost passed out, but eventually managed to yank his leg off the rod, which somehow hurt even worse. Groaning and crying, he rolled over and gripped his leg, trying to stop the bleeding, but the blood just kept gushing through his fingers.

Steve was in trouble. His needed to look around for something he could use as a tourniquet, but he couldn't stand up. In an instant, his mind flashed into the brain interface and he zoomed in on the hangar. He could see himself lying on the ground beside the engine. He could see the giant half-robot. He could see the coveted jet, just over there in the far corner... so close... but so far... Then he noticed some shelving beside the jet. Aside from tools and parts, there seemed to be a greasy rag draped over the edge of one shelf. But he knew he couldn't make it. It was starting to look hopeless...

His mind drifted away from the hangar. He was starting to feel faint. But then he recognized on the map the hallway where he had helped the wounded soldier. It was his last chance.

He zoomed in and saw... nothing but some shelving beside a pool of blood. He drifted again, but shook himself back to alertness. Then he focused on the conference room... There he was! He was halfway across the room, limping toward the other side. An inventory listing of controllable devices dropped into view, once of which was the PA system. He focused on it, and suddenly heard a loud squeal of feedback reverberating through the room. He didn't know how to project his voice through a brain interface, and his consciousness was fading quickly, but he poured every ounce of his will into the attempt to communicate.

Gloooaruuuai- BleoooaaSSSP! Blaao... Plleaazzzzz HEL- LLP! heLLLP MEEEE! HeaaannnnGAR. HAN-GAR! HANGAR!

===

The soldier was confused, but he was certain he heard somebody say "help me" and "hangar." He turned around and hobbled as quickly as he could back out to the hallway. He paused for a moment and grabbed the medkit, just in case, then hopped along out to the alley. He struggled to climb up the loading dock, which took 100 seconds, then proceeded into the hanger, where he saw Steve unconscious in a pool of blood. It was time to return a favor....

Meanwhile, onboard the living areas of the Crossbow Construction Station.
Merial was shooting guns at a range, and she was perhaps one of the best marks(wo)men there, beating even the males.

Elf Male: Damn! You're good! You should join us guys and head to a bar, we'll show you a good time!

Merial didn't answer.

Elf Male: Come on!

The Elf reached for her shoulder with his hand, but he instead found himself on the ground and a pistol pulled up on his head. The people watching Merial do this snickered.

Merial: Sorry, my standards on men aren't set that low.

Merial quickly stood up and left.

Elf Male: Aaah, my head, what's her problem?

Human Female: You idiot! Don't you know that's the Shadow Boss's wife?!

Elf Male: She was? But she... she....

Half-Breed Male: Dude, didn't you see Royal Crossbow Emblem on her Shoulders? The only person who wears something like that is the Shadow Boss!

Elf Male: Oh god! Couldn't I go to jail for this?!

Elf Female: No doubt the Shadow Boss will hear of this, you probably won't be going to jail, but still somewhere pretty bad.

The commotion died down.

Human Female: Say, they say the Shadow Boss's Wife is like an ice queen to everyone but her husband, is that true?

Half-Breed Male: She's actually now reffered to as the Shadow Queen, and yes, they're all lovey-dovey when they're around each other, and then when they talk to you, they're all strict and icy inside, then they go back to acting like a new-wed couple.... Why can't I get a girlfriend like that?

Human Female: Because a female like that only exists in stories.

On july 15, 2014
[8356287]

I just had the most horrible idea. You know, it sucked that we had to boot Manuel out of the story, and I still feel really bad about it. (And I'm sure he does too.) Once we all get aboard the Daedalus, what would you guys think about inviting him back to play the role of a hostile force pursuing and attacking us?

I would want some safeguards in place though. First of all, NO REFERENCES TO ANY GAMES, MOVIES, ETC. He has to come up with his own original ideas, and he has to describe them like an author would. We should also pre-define a rigid framework of combat mechanics that he has to play within, to keep it sane. He should have a set of clear objectives that he's working toward, beyond simply destroying us, so that he'll have to plan a strategy - maybe we have something his characters need, and he has to try to capture it from us, with a reasonable chance of success. Finally, his forces must obey the commands of a supreme ruler, played by EoN, who will be orchestrating the attacks of other hostile forces.

I imagine he might enjoy attacking us, since we were kind of dicks to him. But I don't know, maybe he wouldn't be interested in such a role. I just want to make the offer. But I think we should get unanimous consent first. How do you vote?
On july 15, 2014
[8356287]
EoNightcore Well, it helped you were here.

Heh, it's funny, I practically abandoned my own thread, but I've been prolific in this one. And when I said "my" record, I meant the record set by the thread I started (not that I contributed much to it).


EoNightcoreThat said, what ever happened to that project you were working on?

Ugh, it's a monster. It just keeps growing and mutating... Don't get me wrong, it's pure awesomeness. But it's a veeery, very different process. It provides a set of standardized mechanisms for us to agree on general ideas, so OP characters can't exist without everyone's approval, and there won't be any confusion about things like Jessica being on a plane. I still work on it occasionally, and I still plan to launch it eventually, but I haven't gotten much accomplished since this thread started. I've just been having too much fun participating in this story, and the process seems to be working much better now that we've figured out how to work together. Once we get on the Daedalus, I'll try to let my characters fall into somewhat minor roles, so I'll have more time to finish the UserScript.

[8356287]

Steve awoke to a splitting headache and ringing in his ears. He slowly reached up to grab his head, and then realized that he was still wearing the brain interface. He tugged it off and tossed it across the room. The pain subsided somewhat.

A nurse entered his room and glanced at the monitors.

Nurse: And how are we feeling today?

Steve: Eeeuh. I've been better.

His voice was weak and raspy. The nurse pushed a few buttons on the medical equipment, then turned back to him with a warm smile.

Nurse: Everything's looking good. We'll have you out of here in no time. But NO SWIMMING for the next TWO WEEKS - got it?

Steve: Umm..... yeah. No problem.

Nurse: Just stay put, I'll get your friend.

The nurse walked out to the waiting room and addressed a man in a pilot's uniform.

Nurse: Mr. Quartz? He's awake.

[8356287]

Steve scanned his eyes across the document faster than he could actually read it, but certain words and phrases jumped out at him:

...exceptional piloting skills...

...complete amnesty in exchange for...

...hostile forces...

..counterstrike...

...access to sensitive areas will be strictly forbidden...

...termination of contract...

Steve looked up at the pilot halfway through the third page.

Steve: Is this for real? You guys want me to fly for you?

Steve couldn't help it - a grin cracked across his face.

On july 16, 2014
EoNightcore

Sorry to interrupt your conversation boys, but.

========================

On the Alien Temple Ship, a meeting was occurring on the plans of the invasion of Earth.
Ethereal Councilor 1: Enouvt! Ih ij hipe wok uj ho yonhinue yonquekinv hte tupanj! (Enough! It is time for us to continue conquering the humans!)

Ethereal Councilor 2: Ake cou a wool?! Hte Tupan Jtim pivth xejhkoc one ow ouk ofn avain! (Are you a fool?! The Human Ship might destroy one of our own again!)

Ethereal Councilor 1: Htah jtim ij noh tupan! Ih jtoh ah hte Tupanj ayhuallc! I jujmeyh ih ij anohtek alien kaye teke ho ylaip Eakht! (That ship is not human! It shot at the Humans actually! I suspect it is another alien race here to claim Earth!)

Ethereal Councilor 2: Htah jtim pac tage jtoh ah hte tupanj, zuh hte jhahion ih faj paxe wkop yape wkop Eakht! Ih ij htekewoke a tupan! (That ship may have shot at the humans, but the station it was made from came from Earth! It is therefore a human ship!)

Mush Queen: Venhlepen! Venhlepen, yalp xofn! (Gentlemen! Gentlemen, calm down!)

Ethereal Councilor 2: Fto ake cou ho hell pe ho yalp xofn? Cou'ke nohtinv poke hten a jlage! (Who are you to tell me to calm down? You're nothing more then a slave!

Mush Queen: A jlage I pac ze! Zuh I tage poke rnoflexve hten zoht couk jhumix ajjej! (A slave I may be! But I have more knowledge then both your stupid asses!)

Ethereal Councilor 1: Jilenye jlage! Cou ake noh fo- (Silence slave! You are not wo-)

Uber-Ethereal: Leh tek jmear! I fijt ho rnof ftah jte jacj... (Let her speak! I wish to know what she says...)

Mush Queen: Fell pc tolinejj, hte jtim ij ow eakhtlinv okivinj, zuh ih taj yajh oww ih'j tekihave anx taj xeyixex ho ejyame wkop Eakht, aj htec gief ih aj hoo yokkumh. (Well my holiness, the ship is of earthling origins, but it has cast off it's heritage and has decided to escape from Earth, as they view it as too corrupt.)

Uber-Ethereal: Keallc? Anx tof xo cou rnof ow htij? (Really? And how do you know of this?)

Mush Queen: Pc meomle ake yamazle ow inweyhinv ohtekj anx mkehenxinv ho ze htep, htec ake hte mekweyh jmiej. (My people are capable of infecting others and pretending to be them, they are the perfect spies.)

Uber-Ethereal: I ap inhkivuex on tof a jipmle jlage youlx rnof jo puyt poke hten pc ofn rinx. Cou hfo! (I am intrigued on how a simple slave could know so much more then my own kind. You two!)

The Uber-Ethereal points to the Two Councilors.

Uber-Ethereal: Cou ake tekezc edilex wkop hte Hepmle-Jtim! Iw I pujh jee couk wayej egek avain, I fill uje ih wok hakveh mkayhiye! (You are hereby exiled from the Temple-Ship! If I must see your faces ever again, I will use it for target practice!)

The two councilors leave the room in a hurry.

Uber-Ethereal: Anx cou? Hte Jlage? Cou ake nof pc nefejh Younyilok, younh coukjelw luyrc, noh panc jlagej vain hte kanr ow Younyilok. (And you? The Slave? You are now my newest Councilor, count yourself lucky, not many slaves gain the rank of Councilor.)

Mush Queen: Cej, couk tolinejj. (Yes, your holiness.)

The Mush Queen then thought, "Except, I only serve my own interests".

========================

The Unknown language has popped up again! This time with translations!
Yes, the language exists.
No, it's not a language from real life.
Yes, it's from a show.
No, it's not Sci-fi.
No, it's not elvish, or orcish, or dwarfish, or any of those fantasy languages.
yes, you will be forever wondering what language it actually is.

On july 16, 2014
[8356287]

Steve rolled over onto his knees and stood up. He couldn't put much weight on his bad leg, but he kept his balance.

His thoughts raced through every fantasy he had ever had, since he was a young boy, of piloting a fighter jet. He even still had the jet poster his parents gave him at age eleven - it was hanging over the couch in his living room. This was his dream come true. He looked back at the man with determination in his eyes.

Steve: Don't need legs to fly. I'm ready now.

Darwin was freaked out. She smelled the man who had taken her from her home, and fiercely bit the hand holding the gun. Jeffries jerked back, and the Spec. Ops. soldier grabbed the weapon and turned it on him.

Another black helicopter came down and hovered beside the humvee, with ladders draped out the sides.

NADO Soldier: She's coming with me. You'll come too if you want to live.

The soldier strained to lift the woman with one arm while keeping the pistol trained on Jeffries' head. He backed out of the door and pulled her out, with the help of the other soldier. They rushed her over to the helicopter, and she was pulled inside.

Jeffries opened the rear door and climbed up out of the up-turned vehicle. He hopped down and started trotting toward the chopper, but then stopped and turned back.

Jeffries: ....Goddamn CAT.

He went back and scruffed the cat, yanked her out the window and carried her to the helicopter, getting scratched another 7 times. The helicopter was already lifting off, just as he grabbed the ladder.

ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ
turns to
AZYXEWVTISRLPNOMQKJHUGFDCB

and
AZYXEWVTISRLPNOMQKJHUGFDCB
turns to
ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ

On july 17, 2014
[8356287]

Jessica's eyes fluttered open. She was on a helicopter, with Darwin purring on her belly. Jeffries was the only person she recognized. She was bruised and scraped, but otherwise okay.

Jessica: What happened? Where's Captain Briggs?

Jeffries: There was an accident........

He looked away.

Jessica: You mean... he...

Jeffries: He didn't make it.

Jessica didn't know what to say. She liked Captain Briggs. She trusted him. And now he was dead.

The NADO Soldier in the co-pilot's seat turned around.

NADO Soldier: You're awake. Good. We're getting close to the evacuation rendezvous, so be ready.

She nodded to the soldier and sat up. Darwin curled up in her lap.

The helicopter descended on an airfield with numerous vehicles of all shapes and sizes, ringed by a staggering force of military hardware: tanks and cannons, mechs and missile launchers, things she didn't recognize, and things she was afraid to see. Troops were buzzing around the weaponry, and people were rushing toward one of the large aircraft.

The helicopter touched down, and Jessica clutched Darwin tightly in her arms.
